      Make a and constraint
      static Constraint ifThen(BoolVar BVAR, Constraint CSTR)
      Implication constraint: BVAR => CSTR Also called half reification constraint Ensures:

      - BVAR = 1 => CSTR is satisfied,

      - CSTR is not satisfied => BVAR = 0

      Example :
      - ifThen(b1, arithm(v1, "=", 2));: b1 is equal to 1 => v1 = 2, so v1 !

      • ifThenElse

        public static Constraint ifThenElse(BoolVar BVAR,
                    Constraint THEN,
                    Constraint ELSE)
        Implication constraint: BVAR => THEN && not(B) => ELSE.
        Ensures:

        - BVAR = 1 => THEN is satisfied,

        - BVAR = 0 => ELSE is satisfied,

        - THEN is not satisfied => BVAR = 0

        - ELSE is not satisfied => BVAR = 1

        In order to have BVAR <=> THEN, make sure ELSE is the opposite constraint of THEN

        Parameters:
        BVAR - variable of reification
        THEN - the constraint to be satisfied when BVAR = 1
        ELSE - the constraint to be satisfied when BVAR = 0

      • ifThen

        public static Constraint ifThen(BoolVar BVAR,
                Constraint CSTR)
        Implication constraint: BVAR => CSTR Also called half reification constraint Ensures:

        - BVAR = 1 => CSTR is satisfied,

        - CSTR is not satisfied => BVAR = 0

        Example :
        - ifThen(b1, arithm(v1, "=", 2));: b1 is equal to 1 => v1 = 2, so v1 != 2 => b1 is equal to 0 But if b1 is equal to 0, nothing happens

        Parameters:
        BVAR - variable of reification
        CSTR - the constraint to be satisfied when BVAR = 1

      • reification

        public static Constraint reification(BoolVar BVAR,
                     Constraint CSTR)
